title: 109_s3522
content: The "Fisheries Restoration and Irrigation Mitigation Act of 2006" amends the Act of 2000 by adjusting funding amounts and specifying that certain federal and tribal expenditures for projects under the Program are nonreimbursable. SEC. 3. COST SHARING. Amends the Fisheries Restoration and Irrigation Mitigation Act of 2000 to specify that amounts provided by the Bonneville Power Administration for a project under the Program will be credited towards the non-Federal share of project costs. SEC. 4. REPORT. Amends Section 9 of the Fisheries Restoration and Irrigation Mitigation Act of 2000 to include partnering with local governmental entities and States in the Pacific Ocean drainage area. SEC. 5. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Section 10 of the Fisheries Restoration and Irrigation Mitigation Act of 2000 is amended to extend the timeframe to 2012 and define administrative expenses related to staffing, overhead, and application processing for funding under the Program. The Program allows for up to 6 percent of funds each fiscal year to be used for administrative expenses at the Federal and State levels, with a formula determining the exact percentage based on the total amount available. The Program allocates a percentage of funds for administrative expenses based on the total amount available for the fiscal year. The Program allocates a percentage of funds for administrative expenses based on the total amount available for the fiscal year, with varying percentages depending on the funding levels. The Program allocates 50 percent of funds to Federal agencies and Indian tribes, and 50 percent to State agencies. State expenses for administrative costs are divided evenly among all States receiving assistance under the Program. The Program allocates funds to Federal agencies, Indian tribes, and State agencies. Technical support and assistance for the project sponsor are not subject to the 6 percent limitation on administrative expenses. Staffing expenditures for arranging meetings are included in technical assistance. The Program involves arranging meetings, assisting with funding applications, and providing technical assistance at construction sites upon request.
